description: Leading design showcase platform for high-fidelity UI/UX work, focusing on craft demonstration and designer networking
primary_use: Showcasing high-fidelity design shots, UI components, animations, and micro-interactions for portfolio building and client acquisition

object_details.OBJ-PORT-003: Dribbble Shot - High-fidelity design showcase (1600×1200px, single UI component or animation)

key_features.jobs_board: Designer job listings and freelance opportunities
key_features.pro_features: Custom portfolio URLs, analytics, Pitch Mode

content_types.app_screens: Full mobile or web app interfaces (25%)

technical_specs.image_format: JPEG, PNG, GIF (recommended PNG for transparency)
technical_specs.attachments: Up to 4 additional images per shot

optimal_posting.consistency: Regular posting builds follower base and Pro ranking

algorithm_factors.likes: PRIMARY engagement signal - quality over quantity
algorithm_factors.views: Shot impressions in feeds and search
algorithm_factors.pro_status: Pro members get boosted in feeds and search
algorithm_factors.shot_quality: Editorial team may feature exceptional work

best_practices: Focus on craft quality - single UI component over full screens
Use clean, minimal backgrounds (white or subtle)
Include brief description explaining design decisions
Tag accurately (UI, UX, Web Design, Mobile, etc.)
Add attachments showing variations or context
Engage with community (like and comment on others' work)
Post at consistent times (builds audience habit)
Use Pro account for analytics and discoverability
Showcase final work, not rough concepts
Include typography and color palette details if relevant

shot_types.single_component: One UI element (button, card, icon) - highly focused
shot_types.case_study_preview: Teaser image linking to full project
shot_types.icon_set: Collection of icons in consistent style

content: Link to full project or case study if applicable
Call to action (feedback welcome, available for work)

tagging_strategy.examples: ui, ux, mobile-app, figma, dark-mode, fintech, dashboard

performance_metrics.likes: Primary engagement (aim for 50+ for growing account)

dribbble_pro_benefits.boosted_reach: Higher placement in feeds and search

portfolio_strategy.curation: Only showcase best 20-30 shots (quality over quantity)
portfolio_strategy.variety: Mix of UI, branding, illustration to show range
portfolio_strategy.process: Use attachments to show design iterations
portfolio_strategy.featured_shot: Pin best work to profile top
portfolio_strategy.about_section: Clear bio with specialization and contact info

client_acquisition_strategy.showcase_commercial_work: Clients want to see paid project quality
client_acquisition_strategy.clear_contact_info: Email, website, booking link in bio
client_acquisition_strategy.case_studies: Link to Behance or portfolio for deep dives

animated_gif_best_practices.focus: Single micro-interaction (button hover, menu open, etc.)
animated_gif_best_practices.tools: Principle, After Effects, Figma with plugins

common_mistakes_to_avoid: Over-designed shots (too much in one image)
Posting sketches or rough work (polished only)
integration_opportunities: Cross-post best shots to Instagram (crop to 1:1 or 4:5)
Link Dribbble shots in LinkedIn posts
Use as portfolio thumbnails on Behance
Use in job applications as quick portfolio link
common_use_cases: Building design portfolio for job applications
Showcasing UI/UX skills to attract clients
Demonstrating craft and attention to detail
Finding freelance opportunities via job board
Attracting agency or in-house recruiter attention

behance_better_for: Full case studies and project storytelling

eu_market_considerations.remote_work: Dribbble Jobs board has many EU remote positions

pros: Strong for UI/UX and digital design showcase
Active job board with quality opportunities
Pro account analytics for tracking performance
Strong designer networking and feedback culture
Integrated with designer job market (recruiters search here)
Mobile app for browsing and inspiration
cons: Pro account required for best discoverability ($5/month)
Can feel intimidating for beginners (very high quality bar)
Likes can feel like a popularity contest
Focus on aesthetics over UX problem-solving
Limited case study depth (need Behance for that)
Invite-only for Pro (used to be, now open)
Can be time-consuming to engage properly
Not ideal for non-digital design (print, industrial)
alternative_tools: Behance - Comprehensive case studies and Adobe integration
Instagram - Visual community with broader audience
Pinterest - Long-term discoverability for design inspiration
Figma Community - Design system and component sharing

content_calendar_strategy.balance: Mix personal work and client projects

seo_optimization.shot_descriptions: Include design terms and tools used
seo_optimization.custom_url: Use real name or brand (Pro feature)

analytics_to_track.likes_per_shot: Benchmark quality (50+ is good for growing account)

demographics.geographic: Global, strongest in US, UK, Europe
